Gamepads module¶

api.Gamepads.get_all()[source]¶

Returns a list a list of values for every gamepad connected.

Returns:A list of axes and button data for each connected gamepad
Examples: 
>>> gpads = Gamepads.get_all()
>>> gamepad0 = gpads[0]
api.Gamepads.get_all_buttons(index)[source]¶

Returns a list of button values corresponding to the specified gamepad.

Each button value is either a 0 (not pressed) or a 1 (pressed). Unlike joysticks, there are no in-between values–it can only be a 0 or a 1. To see the exact mapping, click on the ‘Details’ button next to a gamepad in Dawn, or refer to https://w3c.github.io/gamepad/#remapping.

Parameters:index – The index of the gamepad, usually 0, 1, 2, or 3
Returns:A list of 0’s and 1’s, each corresponding to a button
api.Gamepads.get_button(index, button)[source]¶

Returns whether a button is pressed or not.

For a specific button (each button has has a number) the output is either True (pressed) or False (not pressed). To see the exact mapping, click on the ‘Details’ button next to a gamepad in Dawn, or refer to https://w3c.github.io/gamepad/#remapping.

Parameters:
  • index – The index of the gamepad, usually 0, 1, 2, or 3
  • button – The number of the button. See above for mappings.
Returns:

A boolean either True (pressed) or False (not pressed)
api.Gamepads.get_is_connected(index)[source]¶

Returns whether or not the specified gamepad is connected.

Parameters:index – The index of the gamepad, usually 0, 1, 2, or 3
Returns:A boolean value for whether or not that gamepad is connected
api.Gamepads.get_joysticks(index)[source]¶

Returns a list of axes values corresponding to the specified gamepad.

Each returned value is between -1 and 1, which represents where the joystick is along that axis. For example, if axes[0] is -1, then the left joystick has been pushed all the way to the left. In order to get a better sense of the joystick mappings, click the ‘Details’ button next to a gamepad in Dawn or refer to https://w3c.github.io/gamepad/#remapping.

On a standard gamepad: - axes[0] represents the horizontal axis of the left joystick. - axes[1] represents the vertical axis of the left joystick - axes[2] represents the horizontal axis of the right joystick - axes[3] represent the vertical axis of the right joystick

Parameters:index – The index of the gamepad, usually 0, 1, 2, or 3
Returns:A list of 4 decimal values, each corresponding to a joystick axis.
Examples: 
>>> axes = Gamepads.get_joysticks(0)
api.Gamepads.get_left_x(index)[source]¶

Returns the position of the left joystick on the x axis.

The value is between -1 and 1, which represents where the left joystick is along the x axis. -1 means the left joystick is pushed all the way to the left.

Parameters:index – The index of the gamepad, usually 0, 1, 2, or 3
Returns:A double between -1 and 1, negative is pushed to the left.
api.Gamepads.get_left_y(index)[source]¶

Returns the position of the left joystick on the y axis.

The value is between -1 and 1, which represents where the left joystick is along the y axis. -1 means the left joystick is pushed all the way forward.

Parameters:index – The index of the gamepad, usually 0, 1, 2, or 3
Returns:A double between -1 and 1, negative is pushed forward.
api.Gamepads.get_mapping(index)[source]¶

Returns the mapping of the specified gamepad. Usually this value will be ‘standard.’

Parameters:index – The index of the gamepad, usually 0, 1, 2, or 3
Returns:A double between -1 and 1, negative is pushed to the left.

Parameters:index – The index of the gamepad, usually 0, 1, 2, or 3
Returns:A decimal between -1 and 1, negative is pushed to the forward

api.Robot.get_all_motors()[source]¶

Returns the current power values for every connected motor.

api.Robot.get_all_switches(name)[source]¶

Returns whether each limit switch on the identified device is pressed or not

Each of the four limit switches on the device return either True (pressed) or False (not pressed). Each limit switch is specified with an intger, either 0, 1, 2, 3.

Parameters:name – A String that identifies the limit switch smart device (contains four limit switches)
Returns:A list of boolean values, where True is pressed and False is not pressed. The value at index 0 corresponds to limit switch 0, index 1 to switch 1, and so forth.
api.Robot.get_color_sensor(name, color)[source]¶

Returns the value from the color sensor for a specific color.

Each color sensor senses red, green, and blue, returning a number between 0 and 1, where 1 indicates a higher intensity. This function returns the result from one specific color sensor.

Parameters:
  • name – A string that identifies the color sensor
  • color – A integer that identifies which specific color sensor to return where 0 specifies the red sensor, 1 specifies the green sensor, and 2 specifies the blue sensor
Returns:

A double between 0 and 1, where 1 indicates a higher intensity
api.Robot.get_distance_sensor(name)[source]¶

Returns the distance away from the sensor an object is, measured in centimeters

Parameters:name – A String that identifies the distance sensor
Returns:A double representing how many centimeters away the object is from the sensor
api.Robot.get_hue(name)[source]¶

Returns the hue detected at the specified color sensor.

This uses the red, green, and blue sensors on the color sensor to return the detected hue, which is represented as a double between 0 and 360. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hue for more information on hue.

Parameters:name – A string that identifies the color sensor
Returns:A double between 0 and 360 representing the detected hue
api.Robot.get_limit_switch(name, switch)[source]¶

Returns whether a specified limit switch on the identified device is pressed or not

The specified limit switch returns a boolean, either True (pressed) or False (not pressed). Each limit switch is specified with an integer, either 0, 1, 2, 3.

Parameters:
  • name – A String that identifies the limit switch smart device (contains four limit switches)
  • switch – A integer (0,1,2,3) which specifies the limit switch (out of four)
Returns:

A boolean value, where True is pressed and False is not pressed.
api.Robot.get_luminosity(name)[source]¶

Returns the luminosity for the specified color sensor.

The color sensor returns the luminosity detected by the color sensor, represnted by a decimal between 0 and 1, where 1 indicates higher intensity.

Parameters:name – A string that identifies the color sensor
Returns:A double between 0 and 1, where 1 indicates a higher intensity

api.Robot.set_LED(name, light, value)[source]¶

Sets the brightness of a specific LED on the team flag.

Each LED has four levels, represented by integers. Each light is set to 0 (off), 1 (low), 2 (medium), or 3 (high). Each light has a specific index associated with it, an integer 0, 1, 2, 3.

Parameters:
  • name – A string that identifies the team flag.
  • light – An integer (0,1,2,3) which identifies which LED top set.
  • value – An integer (0,1,2,3) which sets brightness for the specified LED
api.Robot.set_all_servos(name, servo0, servo1, servo2, servo3)[source]¶

Sets a degree for each servo to turn.

Each servo (0,1,2,3) is set to turn an interger amount of degrees (0-180)

Parameters:
  • name – A string that identifies the servos.
  • servo0 – An integer between 0 and 180 which sets the amount to (turn in degrees) for servo 0
  • servo1 – An integer between 0 and 180 which sets the amount to (turn in degrees) for servo 1
  • servo2 – An integer between 0 and 180 which sets the amount to (turn in degrees) for servo 2
  • servo3 – An integer between 0 and 180 which sets the amount to (turn in degrees) for servo 3

  • light2 – An integer (0,1,2,3) which sets brightness for LED 2
  • light3 – An integer (0,1,2,3) which sets brightness for LED 3

api.Robot.set_servo(name, servo, value)[source]¶

Sets a degree for a specific servo to turn.

One servo as specified by its number (0,1,2,3) is set to turn an integer amount of degrees (0-180)

Parameters:
  • name – A string that identifies the servo
  • servo – A integer (0,1,2,3) which identifies which servo to turn
  • value – An integer between 0 and 180 which sets the amount to turn (in degrees)
